meanings.definition: To remove paint from a surface.
meanings.sent1: I used a scraper to depaint the old wooden chair.
meanings.sent2: The painter will depaint the walls before applying a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: After a messy art project, I had to depaint my hands from all the colors.
meanings.sent4: The rain started to depaint the colorful mural on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to depaint the vibrant hues of the sunset.

meanings.definition: To represent or describe in a painting or picture.
meanings.sent1: The artist wanted to depaint the beauty of the countryside in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: She carefully depainted the scene of the bustling city on her canvas.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to depaint their favorite cartoon characters on the sidewalk with chalk.
meanings.sent4: Her words depainted a vivid image of the majestic mountains in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The photographer aimed to depaint the emotions of the subjects through his lens.
